context_of_use: This use case allows users to register, log in, and reset their passwords to access their accounts securely.
description: Covers user registration, login, and password reset functionality for account access and recovery.
triggering_event: User initiates account registration, login, or password reset.
preconditions: User must have a valid email address for registration.
postconditions: User is logged in to the system.
assumptions: User has the necessary information to register an account.
User can remember their password or has access to reset it.
requirements_met: The system shall allow users to register an account.
The system shall allow users to log in securely.
The system shall allow users to reset their password.
main_flow: 1. User registers account → System creates user account and confirms registration.
2. User logs in → System authenticates user and grants access to account.
3. User requests password reset → System sends password reset instructions to user's email.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): User provides an already registered email → System informs user that the email is already in use.
AF-2 (from Step 2): User enters incorrect credentials → System denies access and prompts for re-entry.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): User does not receive password reset email → System prompts user to check spam folder or retry.
